answers.content_html: An electric motor transforms electrical energy into mechanical energy.
answers.feedback_html: An electric motor converts electrical energy into mechanical energy.

answers.content_html: An electric motor transforms mechanical energy into electrical energy.
answers.feedback_html: Mechanical energy is transformed into electrical energy by a generator.

answers.content_html: An electric motor transforms chemical energy into mechanical energy.
answers.feedback_html: A mechanical engine transforms chemical energy of petrol into mechanical energy.

answers.content_html: An electric motor transforms mechanical energy into chemical energy.
answers.feedback_html: A generator does not convert mechanical energy into chemical energy.

answers.content_html: A step-up transformer decreases the current to transmit power over short distance with minimum loss.
answers.feedback_html: Remember, a step-up transformer increases the voltage to transmit power over long distances with minimum loss.

answers.content_html: A step-up transformer increases the current to transmit power over short distance with minimum loss.
answers.feedback_html: a step-up transformer increases the voltage to transmit power over long distances with minimum loss

answers.content_html: A step-up transformer increases voltage to transmit power over long distance with minimum loss.
answers.feedback_html: Yes, High voltage results in low transmission current thereby minimizing the power lost during transmission.

answers.content_html: A step-up transformer decreases voltage to transmit power over short distance with minimum loss.
answers.feedback_html: A step-up transformer increases voltage to transmit power over long distance with minimum loss

answers.content_html: The peak emf from a generator can be maximized only by maximizing number of turns.
answers.feedback_html: Peak emf from a generator can also be maximized by maximizing area of the wired loop or frequency.

answers.content_html: The peak emf from a generator can be maximized only by maximizing area of the wired loop.
answers.feedback_html: Peak emf from a generator can also be maximized by maximizing number of turns or frequency.

answers.content_html: The peak emf from a generator can be maximized only by maximizing frequency.
answers.feedback_html: Peak emf from a generator can also be maximized by maximizing number of turns or area of the wired loop.

answers.content_html: The peak emf from a generator can be maximized by maximizing number of turns, maximizing area of the wired loop or maximizing frequency.
answers.feedback_html: Yes, any of the three can maximize the peak emf.

stem_html: How can you maximize the peak emf from a generator?

answers.content_html: The output emf will be doubled.
answers.feedback_html: The emf is proportional to the frequency of rotation of coils

answers.content_html: The output emf will be halved.
answers.feedback_html: There is a direct proportionality between the frequency of rotation coils and emf induced in them.

answers.content_html: The output emf will be quadrupled.
answers.feedback_html: If frequency is doubled then emf will be doubled.

answers.content_html: The output emf will be tripled.
answers.feedback_html: Emf is directly proportional to the frequency at which the coils rotate.

stem_html: How is the output emf of a generator affected if you double the frequency of rotation of its coil?
